comment: I was quite surprised that I would find such a decent whisky in my own backyard. I can imagine that it's not to everyone's taste. But don't get fouled. This is a worthy bottle to have in your collection.
At 46% this is surprisingly light.  Sweet and flowery smell and same taste. Nice to have whisky from real beer mash and all in all a funny whisky making a great addition!
Clear mouty taste, sweet. Long taste, thick. Oranges, triple beer mouty. Very distinct smell
Bright, lemon pith, kind of bitter, wet wood, and some pepper. Reminds me of rye.
Sweet and vanillas on the nose. Fruits. The taste is a bitter orange peel and almost a sour beer note.
A smooth Belgian whisky with a sweet aftertaste.
Definitely strong honey notes that make it too sweet for my taste
Excellent - Miele avec seconde attaque aux pruneaux
Golden straw color.  Grain, alcohol, some pear on the palate.

Tried it bc a friend wanted to know about it and I'll drink almost anything...Also love their beer.

Mmmm malted honey nut cheerios. 

Light with a sweet yet spicy burn on the tongue. Definitely grainy. Not a super rough ride but the youngness is definitely present.

Nice quick burn and warm finish. Short to medium length. 

I still like their beer more but I like how the palate and finish remind me of their ales. age it longer and I can guarantee I'd give this a 4
Vanilla, sweet nose. Thick legs on the glass. Honey taste, pear and reminds me of beer
